intro: Dorstenia debeerstii var. multibracteata, commonly known as the "Cape Cod plant," is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that form a rosette and its ability to curl into a protective structure when disturbed. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often followed by fleshy, red or orange berries. It is native to South Africa and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its rarity and specific care requirements, it is a sought-after species among collectors and botanists.
